sentences.en: Edward VIII had done the unthinkable and abdicated the throne.
sentences.cn: 爱德华八世竟主动逊位，真是匪夷所思。

sentences.en: He is next in line to the throne (= will become king when the present ruler dies ) .
He renounced his claim to the French throne.
sentences.cn: 他正式放弃对法国王位的继承权。

sentences.en: He set up a claim to the throne.
He was the legal heir to the throne.
sentences.cn: 他是王位的合法继承人.

sentences.en: He's relinquished his claim to the throne.
sentences.cn: 他放弃了继承王位的要求.

sentences.en: In 1913, George V was on the throne (= was ruling ) .
the accession of Queen Victoria to the throne
The King's eldest son is the heir to the throne.
sentences.cn: 国王的长子是王位的继承人.

sentences.en: The present ruler, Prince Rainier III, succeeded to the throne on 9 May 1949.
sentences.cn: 现任元首，兰尼埃三世亲王于1949年5月9日继位。

sentences.en: The throne was footed with gold.
sentences.cn: 这御座是用黄金做的脚.

sentences.en: The young king was uneasy on the throne.
sentences.cn: 这位年轻的国王对身居王位感到很不自在.

sentences.en: The young prince pretended to the throne.
sentences.cn: 那位年轻的王子觊觎王位.

sentences.en: There was a dispute about the rightful succession to the throne.
sentences.cn: 对于王位的合法继承权有过一场争论.

sentences.en: When King George abdicated, his brother succeeded him on the throne.
sentences.cn: 国王乔治退位时, 其弟继承王位.

sentences.en: Who was the true heir to the throne?
sentences.cn: 谁是真正的王位继承人?

trans.tran_en: the position and power of being a king or queen
